definition: to intercept/to cut off and capture
to cut off (a length)/to stop/to intercept/section/chunk/length

sentences.english: CICIG agents had intercepted more than ten thousand of the gang’s fugitive conversations.
sentences.chinese: CICIG探員截獲了這夥人一萬次以上的短暫對話。

sentences.english: First West Nile Virus-positive unit of blood intercepted.
sentences.chinese: 從血液中截獲第一例西尼羅河病毒陽性單位。

sentences.english: The goods illegally transported by criminals have been intercepted by the police.
sentences.chinese: 分子盜運的這批貨已被警方截獲。

sentences.english: Sitting in the middle, she can intercept both sides of the conversation.
sentences.chinese: 由於她位於中間，可以截獲會話雙方的內容。

sentences.english: The ship was captured in running the blockade.
sentences.chinese: 該船在偷越封鎖線時被截獲。

sentences.english: We need to create the reply intercept destination manually.
sentences.chinese: 我們需要手動創建應答截獲目的地。

sentences.english: The streamer has been captured in running the blockade.
sentences.chinese: 輪船在偷越封鎖線時被截獲。

sentences.english: How can the tooltip control intercept the mouse messages destined for that window?
sentences.chinese: 工具提示控件又怎麼截獲發送給窗口的鼠標消息呢？

sentences.english: CICIG agents had intercepted more than ten thousand of the gang's fugitive conversations.
sentences.chinese: CICIG探員截獲了這夥人一萬次以上的短暫對話。

sentences.english: Hamas recently seized and burned nearly two million painkillers.
sentences.chinese: 哈馬斯最近截獲並且焚燒了近兩百萬“快樂丸“。

sentences.english: We've now created the intercept destination.
sentences.chinese: 現在我們已經創建了截獲目的地。

sentences.english: In recent years, a lot of bean weevils have been found in import goods, which are difficult to be controlled.
sentences.chinese: 近年來，在進口貨物上截獲到很多的豆象，防治困難。

sentences.english: They intercepted the enemy's battle plan.
sentences.chinese: 他們截獲了敵人的作戰方案。

definition: to track down and seize (a criminal suspect, contraband etc)
(of a bird, fish etc) to be caught in a net/(of a tennis ball) to hit the net/(of a criminal) to be captured
to uncover (a criminal plot)/to break open and capture
to investigate (as detective)/to solve (crime)/to uncover (a plot)/to sniff out/to break in and analyze/detective work/to scout
to check/to examine/to inspect/to exercise restraint
running in opposite direction (buses, trains, ferries etc)
